website_summaries.verdict: The best deal available for a window shade that works as it's suppose to. You won't find any better for a lower price.
pros: Sun-filtering benefits at a budget price
Easy to cut to fit for no-tool installation
No cord operation provides peace of mind for consumers with kids and pets
cons: They are somewhat flimsy, but easy operation and light-filtering ability makes up for this concern

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have a casement/slider window air conditioner!
customer_reviews.text: I live in CA really close to the beach. The house I'm renting doesn't have air conditioning and it gets hot! I bought a window air conditioner for my casement window....slides horizontally instead of up and down. As you can see in the picture....you can't lower the blinds over the A/C unit. I was trying to figure out a way to close the gap next to the air conditioner. These work perfect! You can trim them to size and simply stick them to the bottom of your installed blinds. Doesn't look perfect, but good enough! They keep the sun and heat out and give you privacy. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley R

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy. Can't beat the the price.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy window covering that looks good. I bought two 36x72 and it was enough to cover 4 small windows. In addition to cutting the width, I cut them in half lengthwise, used some extra double stick tape and mounted all four easily. I'm going to get a few more (decorative) clips to hold them up when I want light. You really need one on each side. The material is easy to cut and very lightweight. It's a very thick paper/fabric. I liked it so much I bought another one for a larger window in the guest room.
customer_reviews.author: TaraFru

customer_reviews.title: Great for a DIY Skylight project
customer_reviews.text: I had an idea in my head for some DIY skylight blinds, I just didn't know how to apply it until I found these. They worked perfectly for what I needed, and were a fraction of the cost of the blinds I was looking at in stores. I'm glad I found these. Easy to cut, easy to hang.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: This product has to be the WORST product I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I take reviews seriously and therefore, always try to be objective and look at total buying experience. This product has to be the WORST product I have ever bought. It is flimsy, cheap looking, and should be removed from the market. I feel like I was robbed in every sense!!! This redi shade is nothing like the one I have. The color and texture fails. If I did not cut it already, I would go through the trouble of sending it back on principle, but I did. If Amazon values its customers (and I like to believe they do, they will STOP selling this item).
customer_reviews.author: KAL-EL

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have always used the Redi Shade paper version int he past and they worked great. THESE FABRIC ONES are a complete waste of money. NOTHING sticks to the material of the blinds. The Double-sided tape it comes with is worthless. The tape stays up but the blinds fall. So I ended up using 3M packaging tape to tape these to the upper window trim. Tape stayed up, but the blings didn't adhere. I wish I could return these, but what would I return to Amazon? A crumpled mess of fabric?
customer_reviews.author: JeffWasHereToo!

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a skylight/window in my room that I love but let's be honest it gets pretty bright year round and sitting under it can leave a pretty intense sun burn. I wanted something semi-diy to not bankrupt me and this def delivered! I simply added some Velcro to the clips and voila a perfect solution to my skylight troubles; not to mention it looks modern and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Electric Pin Company

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating to open cheap looking
customer_reviews.text: These shades ate a HUGE pain if you are trying to put them up permanently and need to open and close them often. I absolutely do not recommend them for this purpose. On the other hand a temporary application of these blinds could be helpful in a super temporary situation where you may open them a few times ,but are mostly there just to hang and create a temporary blinder for your window. They looked pretty awful by the time I was done with them. Save yourself the frustration and get blinds you dont have to manually fold up to open
customer_reviews.author: PA

customer_reviews.title: Leaves Sticky Residue on Window Frame!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shades for temporary use and get the job done for a bit until your new shades arrive. However, when you go to remove them they leave a VERY sticky residue on your window frame. I've now tried goo gone, goo off, rubbing alcohol, and finger nail polish remover and none of these are taking the sticky residue off. If you're going to leave these up permanently then great, but if you plan on taking them down I'd think twice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Riesenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Fell Down!
customer_reviews.text: The self-adhesive material (double-stick tape) came off, but not from the window jam, it came off of the blind fabric/material and allowed it to fall off the window. I re-stuck it up there, but it continued to fall until it simply didn't stick anymore. The tape stayed adhered to the window jam, but the fabric wouldn't stay stuck to it. Definitely wouldn't recommend! Can I have my money back?!?
customer_reviews.author: JE1058

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stay up at all.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the pleated look and cheaper than the fancy ones. These seriously are junk. I want my money back. I am sure I won't get it, but I want my money back. These things (I bought 2) didn't even stay up a week (first one) and a month (2nd one). The adhesive won't come off the wood trim, but it didn't even try to stay connected to the shade part. They look SO CHEAP. I would have been better off going to Wal-Mart and paying $5 for the normal blinds with the pull string. These are absolute garbage. They are also super short and look bad when you clip them.
customer_reviews.author: Tamika Shy

customer_reviews.title: WAS I DREAMING?
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING pleated shade. I am 85 and installed this linen look white pleated shade in minutes. Fast free shipping. Paid under $10. Used a serrated kitchen bread knife to trim to size. Like cutting through butter. No tools required. Just press the shade with the attached self sealing tape to the top of the window interior. Don't worry about the length as it self adjusts. I thought this would be temporary but it looks better than my dirt collecting blinds and I won't be purchasing custom shades for hundreds of dollars any time soon. This shade filters the light but doesn't darken the room.
customer_reviews.author: Towers2000

customer_reviews.title: ... comes through these blinds in the daytime is really awesome. You get full privacy but a brilliant white ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality and color of light that comes through these blinds in the daytime is really awesome. You get full privacy but a brilliant white glow. And at night, when they are down and you have interior lights on, they offer the same stark-white, fully private, glow. The only flaw, as others have mentioned, are the plastic clips that come with them. They are cheap and not strong enough to hold the blinds all the way up. I bought some more attractive, small workshop type clips that work and look much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lay

customer_reviews.title: Love my new shades
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why anyone would complain about these shades. They are the best buy I ever made! The glue sticks to a clean surface perfectly, especially after a month of regular use. The clips hold all of the shade up fully without any problems. The complaints they don't sit down all the way is easily fixed by pulling the fabric further down than the window extends. I did not have to wait for gravity to make them cover my windows. They are fast to put up and pull down and block out all view as well as cut back on glare and heat.
customer_reviews.author: Sheralyn Milton

customer_reviews.title: A nice option on for those on a limited budget
customer_reviews.text: These shades are quite nice. I never realized how "cluttered" blinds can appear, with the strings and cords and rods, until I installed these shades. Pros: They are very easy to cut and install. They look beautiful. Very nice, clean, minimalist appearance. Cost effective. Provides nice, soft light in the room during the day. Cons: If you hear a noise outside, it's difficult to discreetly peek out the window, as it is with blinds. Two of the three shades I hung came down within 48 hours of installing them. I easily reattached them with double-sided tape. They move around very easily with the slightest breeze, like opening or closing a nearby door.
customer_reviews.author: K. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We are renting an older town house with abnormal size windows that didn't come with any sort of blinds or curtains. We didn't want to invest a ton as we are renting, and these were perfect! You can cut to fit your preferred size and they're super easy to install. I personally was looking for something that would let light in, but not be able to see into the room and this fit the bill. I did layer it with light blocking curtains in the bedroom though as light still gets though.
customer_reviews.author: Niki R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Handy, Cheap
customer_reviews.text: You really can't beat these for the price. I needed a cheap shade to cover an interior office window for privacy but to preferably still let in some light, and this is perfect. It's quick to cut and mount. If you want to open and close the shade often, you probably don't want this, as you have to clip and unclip. That doesn't apply to me, and the description is clear about this shortcoming, so I'm keeping this at five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Decent option
customer_reviews.text: I like 'em. They look more like cloth than paper so they are not obviously cheap looking. They take two minutes to put up (although that tape is going to leave a big mess when I have to pull them down) and when they get dirty, I can just replace them. They are a great option to put up while you decide what kind of nicer blinds or curtains you might want, or to just keep up if you don't really care like me.
customer_reviews.author: Jetpack39G

customer_reviews.title: Great temporary shade but leaves sticky residue
customer_reviews.text: We just renovated our bathroom and needed something for the window while we waited for our blinds to arrive. This shade was easy to cut with the right tool and sticks nicely. It's let's some light through which is nice too. Update: The adhesive on the shade is very sticky. I had trouble removing the shade from the top of the window and some of the adhesive is still stuck to the surface. I tried to peel it off and also used Goo Gone but could not remove it. The permanent blind covers the area so it doesn't concern me but it might be a problem for others. For this reason, I'm giving the product 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki T

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: I have these two, honestly silly, windows in my home office that I have been trying to cover in an even “okay” way for years. Found this and it worked perfectly for what I needed, and one of these cut in half filled both windows. They let in a lot of light but definitely help keep the room cooler and block unwanted eyes (a high traffic sidewalk is right outside my house and that room). I didn’t mount these to the window sill with the adhesive, however. I had tension rods and rigged the shades with a “pile pocket” around that to hang them. Seems more secure and easier to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: JessL

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These blinds work great. There's not a ton to say about them...they're a fabric/paper type material and they stick to the upper window frame area and hang down. If you are looking for an inexpensive way to block some light or get some privacy, these will probably work for you. Tips: 1. Clean the surface you are going to stick these to well. 2. After the blinds are up and hanging, pull them (gently) all the way to their limit so they can stretch out to full length, then bring the bottom back up to the window sill. The blinds will not extend fully by themselves if you don't.
customer_reviews.author: JVII

customer_reviews.title: They work and look great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my teenage son's bedroom windows to replace an older set of vinyl blinds that were falling apart/slats broken off. I didn't want to spend a lot of money and had already purchased these same blinds 3 years ago for my teenage daughter. They have held up longer than I thought they would! The adhesive is stronger than you think and sticks with no issues. They look really nice too... more of a clean, modern style. You can't beat the price either. They really do look nicer than you'd expect and like I said, they hold up really well. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Blinds quality matches the price, but the adhesion strip is worthless
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cheap solution to help with the heat coming in my large west-facing windows. I read that cellular blinds are the way to go but I wasn't about to drop money on nice blinds for all 6 of the windows. These do the job well enough and are not an eye sore. However, every single one of my blinds separated from its own adhesive strip and fell. Just buy the appropriate tape you need when you purchase these and make sure you take into account what kind of surface you're using. I bought white gaffers tape and didn't even bother with the double-side mess and I read others tried out velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Two problems: 1. Flimsy clips that cannot hold the blind open for more than 60% 2. Leads to poor air circulation
customer_reviews.text: Works great to cover the entire or a bit more thank half the window. It has two problems. 1. The clips it comes with are flimsy and slip out if you try to roll it up all the way. The clips it comes with can only hold pleats at about 60%. In other words it covers the top 40% of the window all the time. Solution: I use large binder clips which holds the shade open all the way to the top. 2. Since it does not have slits like the regular blinds, it does not let air pass through. So if you cover the window then you will end up with poor or no air circulation.
customer_reviews.author: CommomSense

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT 72” long!!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to provide shades for French door windows while gone on vacation. These can be trimmed to fit with regular scissors and take about two minutes to adhere to the door frame. HOWEVER - the shades would ONLY be 72” in length if you completely ironed out the pleats!!! Why advertise them as the length they WOULD be in an UNpleated state? The reality means they did not cover the bottom 2 FEET of the windows. So plan accordingly when reading the advertised dimensions .....because you are NOT getting the length you will need.
customer_reviews.author: Elliz

customer_reviews.title: Good idea crappy quality
customer_reviews.text: The screen felt from the tape after 2 days the tape stayed on the wall 🙄 It's a good idea but they need to use a better quality tape. I would return it but I thought it was a done deal when I installed and thrown away the box, I really like it before it felt.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price and function
customer_reviews.text: I kind of love these. We didn’t want curtains and the quote for blinds for $1600. We like it open but during certain months the sun is blinding for a few hours. To the point we can’t eat at our dining table. I did modify them a little. I sewed a pocket on the last fold and inserted a dowel rod so they would sit flatter when opened and closed. They aren’t 96 inches like the window but we really didn’t need them all the way to the floor. I ordered two more for the side windows even though they don’t get sun I want to to look more uniform.
customer_reviews.author: RenaC

customer_reviews.title: and loved them so much that I purchased more for home ...
customer_reviews.text: I "installed" these in my office four years ago, and loved them so much that I purchased more for home use. I've never had an issue with them, and much prefer them to standard blinds or vinyl shades--the paper gives a lovely diffusion to the light, the price can't be beat, and they require no upkeep or dusting at all. For being so inexpensive, they add a lot of style to a space. Customizable size is a plus too.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Works, looks nice. I wish I would of thought about how to adhere it to the top of the window better, so that people could not see the first strip of the shade that is adhered. Wish I could of flipped the shade around after I put it up but did not want to chance it in case it would not adhere well if taken down and put back up. The 2 clips work/hold the fabric when putting the shade up. My Mom feels this shade looks very nice in her laundry room window. Good price also!
customer_reviews.author: Daisylover

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install and look nice!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I followed what some of the other reviewers have said, and cleaned the window frame with alcohol before adhering them. I also purchased a nice set of tablecloth weights ( specifically) to help weigh them down as people were correct and the clips they come with are not heavy enough. I use 2 weights per shade, though 3 would probably be better. I replaced all 5 broken up blinds in my house with these shades, and cutting them to size was extremely easy, just make sure you use a really nice sharp knife and you'll get a clean, good looking cut.
customer_reviews.author: diannetea

customer_reviews.title: Consider carefully where you use this. Could be perfect, or not
customer_reviews.text: Mostly it works for my purpose, covering a window behind my sink. Gravity is flattening the top pleats, and it's becoming an exercise in patience to carefully gather up the pleats to open the shades. The clips barely hold the gathered pleats, sometimes they flip away, and these pleats seem to want to straighten up and.lose their creases. So far I am winning, and I don't let the shade down every day. Best use would be for a window that stays covered, and where you want filtered light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our laundry room that has a small window and people can look inside. This works perfect to fix that. It's super easy to install, just measure the window in width and cut the material to that size and then peel and stick. I personally added two thumb tacks to hold it in because the adhesion wasn't that good. This also comes with two clips incase you wanted to roll up the blinds a bit and it will hold it in place. Looks great and works great and was a simple cheap fix for us.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive strip on these are terrible. I find them on the floor every day. I finally had to tape them to the window frame and it looks awful. One star for adhesion is generous. They deserve a negative number for adhesion. Quite possibly the worst item I've ever bought on Amazon. Once our window treatments are installed these will go in the garbage where they deserve to be
customer_reviews.author: JBruno1954

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my windows.
customer_reviews.text: I've got long, think windows flanking my bed. I cut one of these in half and was able to do both with one shade. When first hung, it was tight and only hung about halfway. I attached a pin (jewelry brooch) on the bottom of each to weight it down and pull it longer. That worked great and now I don't need the pin to keep them down. It filters the light so you still get a nice, soft glow, but it provides complete privacy and looks nice. It looks like fabric, but it's more like heavy paper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great now, and lets plenty of light in
customer_reviews.text: My home office window looks right into my neighbor's yard and so I bought these to allow light, yet provide privacy. The stickies did not hold the first day, the shade dropped over night. Not sure if perhaps the they don't stick well to the type of oil based paint that is on the inside frame of my window? Not to despair, I pressed it back up and then pushed several evenly spaced white thumbtacks to secure it. Works great now, and lets plenty of light in. Very pleased even though I had to modify it a bit. Considering another one for the spare room. The price is right.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenEliza

customer_reviews.title: Just 1 shade, fabric material
customer_reviews.text: There may be a better deal on a few sets of these. Luckily I only needed 1 to really tie me over, but I bought this thinking there were multiple shades and that these were a plastic and not fabric material. Oh well. Just look for a better deal than this product! I used double sided gorilla tape and that holds it on really well, even with a ton of wind. My wind is at a 45 degree in an attic space, so that’s where I have the gorilla tape pulling down the entirety of the shade, nice and taught.
customer_reviews.author: Treasure

customer_reviews.title: one shade will not hold
customer_reviews.text: After a wet spring I finally washed the windows and put up the new shades. One fell down I tried to press it firmly in place only for it to fall off during the night. The tape separated from the shade it would not stick. Is this a common problem? I need to order more approximately 5 but I hesitate. How do you stand behind your products? Thank you for your time, Claire Morran 860-305-2132
customer_reviews.author: Claire Morran

customer_reviews.title: Needs Velcro
customer_reviews.text: So, even though these say they are 72 inches long, they don't hang down far enough on my 63 inch long window. I'm going to have to buy some Velcro to get it to stay down on the windowsill. There was another brand here on Amazon that came with velcro. I wish I'd purchased that one. Other than that, I really like them and can't beat the price. In the second photo, I used the clips on the back to make a nice fanned variation.
customer_reviews.author: Jette

customer_reviews.title: love everything about these blinds
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get these for my new home based on some reviews but everything about these blinds is perfect. They fit all widows when cut to size - I used a sharp knife like comments suggested. They're thin enough to let light in but not so thin you can see/be seen through them. The install was SO easy, the hardest part was removing the old plastic blinds that were preexisting my move it. Honestly, if you need nice affordable blinds and hate plastic blinds, get these. You won't be sorry you did.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Just peel and stick! As long as you don’t peel it off a few times then it sticks and stays. Mines been hanging for months and hasn’t come down at all! Used on that window to block the morning sun here in Florida which comes directly through and does a great job of blocking the light and some of the heat. Material is also easy to cut. Comes with 2 plastic clips to hold the bottom up.
customer_reviews.author: Samm D

customer_reviews.title: clips that came with fabric shade are not large enough to hold the 72"
customer_reviews.text: RE: 36 x 72 light filtering FABRIC shade. Like the fabric but the 2 clips that come with it are not large enough to get the entire 72" in them so that the shade can go all the way up during the day. It leaves about 15" hanging from the top which is not acceptable. Also, 4 clips should be used for this heavier shade (vs paper shade) to prevent sagging on the 36" or larger width. Any suggestions on what apparatus I can use to get all the shade up? These clips work fine on the 72" paper shade, just not the fabric one.
customer_reviews.author: CJ in KC

customer_reviews.title: Genius idea!!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Easiest blind install I have done in my life. You trim them to fit the window if needed. (Trimming broke cheap scissors, but not a big deal.) You peel the backing and stick them to the wall. Stick them crooked, not a big deal you can gently peel and fix it. They are a fabric blind not plastic, which after plastic blinds is a relief. No pesky slits to deal with, or strings to pull. They are crease-folded and stretch out with a gentle tug. They gently diffuse sunlight and the clips to hold them up are fairly thick and not heavy. Very pleased with this awesome product!! Genius idea!
customer_reviews.author: FireWitch1

customer_reviews.title: Window upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My back door is a complete glass window and I bought a window covering similar to this a while back. The previous window covering was paper and my back door is in the kitchen so that didn’t survive too well. This new covering is more of a fabric and definitely heavier/thicker than its paper predecessor. It was extremely easy to install. Took me all of 3 minutes to get it measured cut and adhered to my door. I stuck it directly to the glass where the other one was and it hasn’t budged. Highly recommended for a quick fix or long term covering.
customer_reviews.author: Kash

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy installation
customer_reviews.text: We have just moved into newly built house and had to wait for window measurements and shutters to be fabricated. This was a little inconvenient with bare windows and came across this idea while shopping at Lowe's. After price comparison and product reviews, my husband and I decided to order these. I am definitely impressed with the ease of installing as well as the quality of material. I now do not feel rushed to decide the window coverings on all the windows and can afford to wait until after I paint.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Batronis

customer_reviews.title: Great when repurposed for arched windows.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the shade as intended in a rectangular window. I cut it into 3 equal pieces and placed them in the rounded top portion of my arched windows. I had to put double sided tape on one side, but these worked perfectly. I knocked a star off because Redi Shade sells the same exact shade for that specific purpose but for triple the cost. No thanks. But $9 to fix up 3 of my windows is a great deal. Will add pictures later.
customer_reviews.author: Mahir A.

customer_reviews.title: length is actually 48 inches
customer_reviews.text: (the blinds separated from the sticky strip after a few weeks but i put them back up with push pins, still looks nice tho) these are a temp solution, fast and easy, super happy with the look, the length i think is misleading, i didn't think about the folding on the fabric just assumed they will hang to 72 inches whoops! they actually hang 48 inches...i ended up up duct taping mine down lower hoping that will loosen the folds...i had to adjust one a bit and the sticky stuff took a dime size chunk of paint off, but still sticking even with the pull of the duct tape, so i would recommend these, nice quality over all!
customer_reviews.author: ellocina

customer_reviews.title: Paper sunshade
customer_reviews.text: Plus: 1) it does what it is supposed to do 2) good price 3) material seems sturdy 4) looks good when still up Negative: 1) the adhesive sucks 2) the adhesive sucks 3) the adhesive sucks 4) there is no drawstring to pull up. It just hangs. Would i purchase again? Maybe. Also, make sure you measure correctly. I goofed up on the length/width but decided to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Trekkie71

customer_reviews.title: The adhesive doesn't hold
customer_reviews.text: The tape is either old or not effective in the window sill where I need it attached. It fell down multiple times within a few hours of putting them up on a clean surface. Does anyone have recommendations for a least invasive solution? I don't want it to damage the paint either.
customer_reviews.author: Family of Four

customer_reviews.title: Waaaay too short for a 72" window
customer_reviews.text: That 72" length is if you pull all of the pleating out of the shade, then you'd have to find some way to adhere it to the bottom sill to keep it taut. My window is exactly 72" in length, and left to hang on its own this comes about 3/4 of the way down without destroying the shade. I had to leave the blinds in over the shade to hide that little booboo, which kind of defeats the purpose of the purchase. But in a window where it actually fit, it would be great. It's a very nice shade.
customer_reviews.author: P. J.

customer_reviews.title: Don't get the white color
customer_reviews.text: Don't get the white color. The material itself is ok. It attaches to the window very easily. It has a "neat" look to it. However, the white color does not block any light. The shade just glows bright white. I ordered two, and put one in a very wide window. It only covered half the window, so I could compare blocked vs. unblocked halves of the window. I don't see any difference between the covered and non-covered side. Having a glowing white piece of paper in the window is not going to reduce light. I just ordered the black color.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Shelby

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for our windows in our extra room. They work very well in blocking enough sunlight. However, the only issue I've come across is the clip used to open the blind; they tend to fall apart. I think the clips are too small if you want to open the blinds fully. For the price, I feel it is a bit too expensive, but it gets the job done. You can find similar products in Ikea for way cheaper and the same material.
customer_reviews.author: EMEM

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but hard to put in "up" position
customer_reviews.text: The shade works fine, but it takes 3 or 4 hands to conveniently fold up and put on the clips in the up, or open, position. Also you will need to go to the dollar store and get some larger clips (you will need 3) to hold it open. It comes with only two small inadequate clips. Otherwise it would get another star. It does the job of blocking the sun well and lets lots of indirect light through. Because it's so inconvenient to raise and the crummy clips they send it deserves 3 or 4 stars, otherwise it would be a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H

customer_reviews.title: I've bought a lot of these, they're great!
customer_reviews.text: I have these on most windows in my home. Looks a lot nicer than mini blinds. I live in a city where the view isnt that great. So, I dont prop them up. The clips that come with them are cheap, but I don't care b/c I dont use them. I like how the light come through, but people cant see in. It is kind of dimming though, so I wouldn't recommend to people with a lot of house plants.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy these!
customer_reviews.text: We have a few similar shades throughout our house, but they are the flimsy paper kind. I was expecting this shade to be equally flimsy, but this fabulously shocked my expectations. Super sturdy (considering it IS a fabric shade :P), easy to cut, and the adhesive is really strong so that I didn't have to worry about it falling. I will definitely be purchasing again in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price point! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 7 shades in total. Bought 2 to start and liked them so much I bought 5 more for other rooms. Great product for the price! Doesn’t look cheap, filters light nicely, and great for those who can’t hang other blinds (apartments/rental). Not as long as advertised, so beware of that, but we stretched it a bit and clipped it to the window itself. I’d only recommend attaching these to the window frame itself, not the wood frame around your window. Looks nice and clean! Should clean up nicely when pulled off with some alcohol or cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last a month
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about these & once I put them up they looked great & they were perfect for my newborns room. They havent even bee up a month yet & keep falling down. The adhesive strip is stuck on the woodwork & it came off the shade so now it wont stay up. I'm really disappointed & even though these are inexpensive they're a waste.
customer_reviews.author: John & Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect if you don't want to spend the big bucks on custom shades. They are so easy to put up, they look like they are the real deal, block out is great, nice light comes through, great for guest rooms, you just cut the side you want altered. I like the fact that it's wide enough to fit just about any window in my house. I have tall ceilings, therefore these work great in length.
customer_reviews.author: Mypurrogative

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well
customer_reviews.text: I put this up in a storm door to block hot pm sun. That actually made the handle too hot to touch. It been up several months, I knock it around a bit going in and out of the house and it’s just fine. No tears, still sticking fine. On a window, should last a long time. Not for putting up and down a lot, kind of a pain to fold up the pleats since they flatten out while hanging but that’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: nrevvy

customer_reviews.title: Not like the other...
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these previously from same seller and this time around the adhesive was pulling off on one end and the bottom of the shade itself was frayed like it had been drug against a rough surface...
customer_reviews.author: Terra Henggeler

customer_reviews.title: They Don't really fit 72"
customer_reviews.text: As you can see I already have blinds installed in my windows, but they are VERY heavy to raise all the way up and down and I can't replace because I'm renting. I thought maybe I could get these cheap paper blinds to give me a little privacy at night without having to wreck havoc on my hands trying to pull the blinds up in the morning. My windows are about 72" long and the paper blinds don't cover the whole window leaving about 12ish inches of uncovered window. Only Home Depot seems to carry the 90" paper shades, so I'll have to place another order.
customer_reviews.author: AN Perkins

customer_reviews.title: This was a totally waste of $7 because it is just a piece of fabric with no adhesive or clips
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of time and money. Now Amazon wants me to spend more time returning it. They shouldn't even send out defective products like this. It said there was some flaw tot he top (true, but not awful)==but the real problem was no adhesive to install and no clips to allow it to be useful. Amazon, I've been a customer for 20 years--and this is not what I expect from you!
customer_reviews.author: S J Baker

customer_reviews.title: Clips don't work
customer_reviews.text: This is neat if you are using them on windows you never use, but the clips are not functional enough to work with everyday use. For the price, these shades aren't bad, but they also aren't a complete product, as you will need to buy different clips to use them functionally. For 8 dollars, I still have to give them 4 stars, but I am still a little bummed about how poorly designed the clips are.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Capitula

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I was looking at roman shades and just couldn't spend the money on the real things. These look great and function well. Installation was quick and easy. You simply cut them to size, pull off the adhesive strip, and hang them! They look wonderful and I'm going to have to get more when I start doing the back of the house. Thanks for a great product at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: It works and it's cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to double up with my existing blinds. My window slides horizontally but my existing blind goes up and down. By using this, I can now shade the sun when I crack the window for airflow. It works great! The material is quite nice, it's soft to touch. Installation is very easy, just cut and stick, it's the easiest window covering I ever installed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Karman

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something temporary while I wait for custom window shades. This is perfect for what I needed, and bonus that there won't be any holes left over from installation! I did have to weigh the bottom down with heavier clips, but I think it will get stretched out after a few days and no longer need the heavy clips. It took me about 30 seconds to "install," so can't beat that!
customer_reviews.author: Pickles

customer_reviews.title: overall they were good for my use and couldn't beat the cost
customer_reviews.text: i bought a few of these because I couldn't find the sizes I needed for our windows and wanted something I could cut to size and just needed something temporarily. The shade was thinner than I expected and the clips were cheap and barely fit over the fabric edges...overall they were good for my use and couldn't beat the cost. The sticky top worked very well - we actually had a hard time taking them down when the wooden blinds finally arrived. If you're looking for high quality don't bother with these but for a dorm or temporary solution it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C Nelson

customer_reviews.title: "Great inexpensive blind'
customer_reviews.text: I used this inexpensive white blind over a window in a bedroom near a bathtub. It was a perfect fit except for the length but thats what this blind is good for you can cut it to your length. This blind came on time and in a long box so it wasn't bent. This item was described by the seller. The sticky backing is still holding up and it has been several months. If your needed something quick and inexpensive this is a great item to choose. I hope this helps others.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S.

customer_reviews.title: These blinds shouldn't be worth more than $1
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 sets of blinds. They all fell off of the window within 2 days and will not readhere for more than an hour. These were a terrible idea in the first place because they do not hang uniformly -- the pleats separate unevenly and will bend out of shape. The clips are extremely cheap plastic and have barely any hold. These were a complete waste of money and I could tell immediately after opening them that these belonged at the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: rsko

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to regular blinds
customer_reviews.text: After reading mixed reviews, I went ahead and bought these blinds. We are prepping the house to move, so we took down our old blinds to paint and didn't want to hang them back up. I had to cut about an inch of the width of the blinds to fit the window; and it cut pretty easily with razor knife. When I went to stick the blind to the top of the window opening, it was a little crooked, but I was able to unstick it and reposition with no problem. I am so pleased with these blinds, that I am considering using them in my new house!
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stick, doesn't stretch
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Redi Shade pleated blinds in both paper and fabric and both have not adhered for more than a day before falling down. The double-sided tape is not the only problem; even when I've used third party double-sided tape and third-party carpet double-sided tape, the same things happen. Curiously the tape stays on the wall, but falls off of the shades, leading me to believe this is a manufacturing defect. I've bought similar shades through Ikea on the same windows and had no problems for years. Unfortunately you seem to get what you pay for with these inexpensive shades.
customer_reviews.author: CGinA2

customer_reviews.title: Temporary fix, not permanent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up but eventually fell off multiple times and didn’t stick anymore after that. It would probably stay up for a weekend if you had someone visiting your first apartment and wanted it to look decent or you’re taking pictures to sell your house. If you want something long term, look elsewhere. It looked nice while it lasted!
customer_reviews.author: Meta

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited for these on the purchase of my new place. One of the blinds has a defective crease down the middle. Both blinds have fallen off the adhesive overnight, even though I have followed the directions. The adhesive tape stuck onto the surface but not on the blind itself. I had to tape them back up myself until I get something more permanent.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good blind for temporary use
customer_reviews.text: The blind is easy to cut-to-fit with regular scissors. The glue is a little weak on the product side. After a couple months the blind fell down, but the glue strip remained on the window channel. This would work great as a temporary solution, or somewhere where you don't mind a little duct tape to hold it in place (basement, garage, etc)
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't stick.
customer_reviews.text: It DID stick for about a week. I have bought other shades like this over the past couple years and they are STILL sticking. Yes, they are incredibly easy to install. But a week later they end up on the floor. So now what? Use double sided scotch tape to force them to stay? I'll give it a try and let you know how that works...but save yourself the hassle and do not buy this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kellisima

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but would not recommend on standard windows, or if you want to have them up
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap so whatever I'm out 10 bucks but I wasn't very impressed. They installed easy enough but immediately they fell down and the middle wasn't falling to the same distance. You can't really have these at different heights , and to be honest, I can't find a good way of keeping them up without retrofitting my own solution in place. not really worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: changing review from 5 star to 1 star... THEY KEEP FALLING
customer_reviews.text: We live in a rental that had awful moldy/dusty fabric Roman shades that were really affecting my allergies. They had to go and I needed a replacement that was cheap and easy. These are awesome! Clips are included so don’t buy them separately like I did! 2 included with each. Falling down every hour. I tried taping them up. Idk why the adhesive isn’t sticking. Using in 5 different rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions NOT as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and stick as advertised. Expensive for lots of windows. Poor rating because of the dimensions. The width is what it is but the length is NOT as advertised. The 72" advertised must be fully extended without any pleating. With pleating, they only hang down about 48". Very disappointing. Couldn't be used in master bedroom window at all. Had to tape down with masking tape in the bathroom windows. (Remodeling -- awaiting new blinds.)
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: These were perfect for my two little windows
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30 x 30 square window on my bay window area. These were perfect for my two little windows! Some people have bad reviews on the stick on shades but these are awesome! I havent had any issues on the sticky part not lasting. We also dont really mess with them too much. If i want some sun I will use the clips provided to clip the windows open, besides that it blocks enough sun out for the room to stay cool.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Good for the value
customer_reviews.text: I bought my second house and the windows in the garage and basement had no blinds, I idnt want to spend a ton of money on blinds, but these are awesome for the value. They are easy to cut to size, I used scissors, would of been easier with a knife I think. They look good and add privacy to my basement and garage/ Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: W. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, won’t last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shade to see how it looked and I’m glad I didn’t spend any more on it. The pleats do not fold up straight, the two clips only hold the two areas they are clipped on, the adhesion pulled away after a few weeks and the shade finally fell. If you’re looking for a nice, permanent window treatment, this isn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: These shades are meh...i put them up with ease..but the next day one fell, so i suggest if u get these please order some double sided sticky tape because the adhesive on these are like school glue...lol since i use double sided tape mines has been up for awhile no problems except u may have to get more shade clips..i dont think the ones it came with was efficient enough to hold these shades up..they are almost like clothespins...
customer_reviews.author: Torri H

customer_reviews.title: Good for price, just don't expect the adhesive to stick
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly good blinds for the price. The blinds are easy to handle, do a good job of filtering out the light and providing another layer of security, however don't expect the adhesive to stay. After one day, the blinds came down and I ended up nailing the fabric down as well as adding velcro re-enforcements.
customer_reviews.author: BESTLiFE

customer_reviews.title: Proper privacy on a budget!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase! It was a great and cheap solution for my windows. They are extremely easy to cut to size and apply. I was able to cut through them with just a pocket knife! The clips are great and keep the shades open just fine. They let a lot of light in while still providing privacy from the outside. Even at night! I had my kids stand in the windows and went outside to see if I could see them and I couldn't. Barely even a shadow. I plan to buy more for a couple other windows in our home.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: These replaced some outdated curtains on our front windows. It brightened up the area and looks nice for little cost. I have one that keeps falling. Its probably due to the animals using that window to look out of. I will try the command strip to adhere it as people seemed to recommend that. Overall, I'm glad I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Wille

customer_reviews.title: Don't Stay Up!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problem with the adhesion, both of these have been sticking strong since day one. The problem is that you can't clip them all the way up! They are only really good for halfway down and lower. The clips are not big/strong enough to handle the shades more than halfway. Since I like having the shade completely open sometimes, this is very inconvenient, and now I need to figure out a solution to keep them up. Wish I had just bought other shades (cause these are also a pain to take off!).
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Best amazon purchase I’ve ever made
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! Took ten seconds to install and has dramatically reduced the sun rays of death coming in through our laundry room on the west side and a bathroom on the east side of the house. They are actually kind of cute! I bought special tape that someone recommended in a review but will return it as these adhered perfectly to painter walls.
customer_reviews.author: Nutmegly

customer_reviews.title: fast and simple to install
customer_reviews.text: great invention no more hardware! took all the old hardware down from the old mini blinds plug the holes then put these up in my kitchen. they are simple and look fresh and clean no more mini blind cords and stick to open them hanging down really looks nice! it was easier for me to trim them to fit by unfolding them measure with a square and cutting them with sharp scissors.
customer_reviews.author: beasharp

customer_reviews.title: Had to "macgyver" clips to hold shades up!
customer_reviews.text: The shade is as expected, quality level between thick paper and rigid fabric which is exactly what I needed for privacy from neighbors at night. The problem isthat the clips that hold the shades up are slippery and the pinch power is not strong enough to hold the weight of the folded material. I remedied this problem with rubber bands and crazy glue. I glued pieces of rubber bands on the inside of the clips and VOILA!! Unfortunately, this otherwise great product fails to meet expectations out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchy

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for Best Look
customer_reviews.text: For the price and ease of installation these are awesome. I had every window done in my house in like 30 minutes or so. Only dislike is the clips for putting them up but hey like again, for the price and appearance it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Garret

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and clips missing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 and only one came with clips to keep it closed. They are very cheap and get smudged easily. The adhesive did not even hold for a day. Command strips(not included) do work to hold up the blind, but you have to use a number of them. For now I'm using them, but will probably have to be replaced soon. I'll also need to find some other clips.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ames

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Bought five of these. All five fell off the windows to which they were adhered within 24 hours of installation. The glue strips separated from the fabric and remained adhered to the window sill. Shade would not re-adhere to glue strip. Complete garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS * READ THIS * READ THIS
customer_reviews.text: The reviews about the awful adhesion are correct. We had no problems at all with them staying up, however, because we used this to keep them there:  We had this for another project and it also worked perfectly to keep the shades up.
customer_reviews.author: Choose Wisely

customer_reviews.title: A great buy.
customer_reviews.text: A quick, easy, in-expensive solution. Two of mine have come loose once (maybe because it was a challenge for me to reach when I put them up, I pushed them back up against the window frame and they have stayed, if it happens again, since my frame is wooden I think I will push in a few thumb tacks.
customer_reviews.author: Beckie Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Tasteful shades
customer_reviews.text: I love these shades. If installed correctly most people wouldn't know you only paid a few dollars. Great if you have a lot of windows but not a lot of money. If you want to elevate the look, replace the supplied plastic clips with something nicer you can pick up from any of the larger crafts stores. 5-star adhesion if you stick it up once and leave it so get it right the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Dahreen

customer_reviews.title: Good product (with alterations) and GREAT 5 star Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect answer to our "late afternoon blazing sun in the window" problem. The only problems are the clips that come with the shade don't hold it when fully closed (not strong enough to hold all the folds). I had to replace the clips with stronger ones, which weigh more, and were too much for the adhesive strip. I added a strip of carpet tape which solved the problem. An email to RediShade customer service explaining the problem and the solution was promptly replied to with appreciation for the feedback, and assurance that Quality Control would be notified. Excellent Customer Service! I'm ready to buy another one! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Beulke

customer_reviews.title: JUST BUY THESE! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking about buying these, DO IT! JUST DO IT!!! I haven't been more pleased with a purchase in a long time! I have odd sized windows in my home and blinds/shades are always a hassle for me, I decided to purchase some of these and they are so easy to work with, look super nice like the expensive brands, and will fit pretty much any size window. I am literally so happy with this purchase I am going to order more next week to do all my windows! You will not be disappointed!!!!! And for the price these are a steal!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tinsley H

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware of incorrect dimensions
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware of incorrect dimensions. The dimensions listed for this product are 36” x 72”, what they don’t list is which is which. I received a shade that is 72” wide and 36” long! Hopefully it will work for a bathroom window but I was surprised when I opened the box. The dimensions are misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Diaz

customer_reviews.title: good privacy shade
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a few of these for window privacy. Definitely prefer these to the paper ones. They don’t feel like they will rip and wrinkle like the paper ones. They were easy to cut and install. Doesn’t filter much light which is fine as I like room to be bright. Works for the reason I bought them - for privacy.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2KL

customer_reviews.title: Only 72 inch if you pull it taut
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive strip peeled off within 2 days. It says 72 inches long so i figured it would be ample forna 60 inch window. Wrong. You'd have to pull it completely taut, eliminating the pleats, to get 72 inches. It covered about 2/3 of the 60 inch lk g window. The paper feel of it was ok, didn't expect much for the price anyway, but overall not usable. Won't stick.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A.

customer_reviews.title: good for tempoary use
customer_reviews.text: These are very cheap quality blinds. They are easy to cut and very easy to hang. They do provide privacy and look okay when fully extended. The lightweight makes them want to spring up, even with the clips. Eventually the will stretch out. They worked for my use but I will def be getting better quality coverings eventually that will be overall more functional.
customer_reviews.author: itcomesincolor

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my one problem window!
customer_reviews.text: Love this paper light filtering blind. This is perfect for a window where you need to filter out the light. We just remodeled our kitchen and I am so tired of the cafe type curtains. I have one window where the sunlight just blazes in and I needed something to put there, even just temporarily. This is the perfect solution for me, easy to install and looks really nice. It is a great solution until I decide what I want for my Kitchen windows.
customer_reviews.author: NT

product_meta.title: Original Light Filtering Pleated Fabric Shade White, 36” x 72”
product_meta.description: Style:Pleated Light Filtering Fabric| Size Name:36” x 72”| Color Name:WhiteRedi Shade’s Original Light Filtering Fabric Shade is the temporary or permanent window covering solution you need, with the look you want. This shade allows you to match decor in any space. It creates instant privacy, softly filters light and blocks sunlight and UV rays. Trim this pleated shade at home for a perfect fit, then install without any tools – no drill, screw or brackets needed. These light filtering fabric shades are available in white and are made from soft, 100% non-woven polyester. Contact Redi Shade if you need help or have questions 1-888-608-6611 or customersupport@redishade.com
feature_bullets: Trim at home for the perfect fit inside or outside your window frame, then install in seconds without a drill, screws, or brackets – no tools needed
Softly filters light for privacy, light control, and UV protection – made of non-woven polyester fabric
No Cords for a clean look and child safety – use included clips to raise and lower shade. Required Mount Depth- Minimum – 1 1/2 Inches. Flush – 2 Inch, inside or outside mount
Works as a stand-alone solution, or easily layer behind existing window treatments. Recommended window depth is 1.5
Perfect solution for: home, apartment, dorm, moving, remodeling, RV/camper/houseboat
Note: Please use rubbing alcohol to prime the surface before installation, and to install on a smooth, flat surface that is not freshly painted

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars3,807 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
